sentences.en: A cool breeze caused a precipitate drop in the temperature.
A slight mistake could precipitate a disaster.
sentences.cn: 小错误可能会招致大灾难。

sentences.en: Adding sulphate to the solution will give a precipitate.
sentences.cn: 将硫酸盐加入该溶液会产生沉淀.

sentences.en: At these levels carbon does not precipitate like oxygen, nor is it electrica lly active.
sentences.cn: 这一浓度下碳既不象氧一样沉淀, 也不呈电治性.

sentences.en: Clouds usually precipitate as rain or snow.
Emitters on trickle system can be blocked by precipitate.
sentences.cn: 灌溉系统中的发射器会被沉积物所堵塞.

sentences.en: He had been afraid that he was about to precipitate another conversation upon the marriage question.
sentences.cn: 他刚才一直在担心又要谈到婚姻问题上去.

sentences.en: He thought Miss Archer sometimes of too precipitate a readiness.
sentences.cn: 他觉得,阿切尔小姐有时太性急,太直接了当.

sentences.en: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.cn: 我认为我们不应该贸然作出决定。

sentences.en: Iron and aluminum compounds precipitate as a voluminous sludge.
sentences.cn: 铁和铝的化合物成为一种体积庞大的蓬松的游渣沉淀下来.

sentences.en: It would only serve to precipitate his ruin.
Jackson's actions helped precipitate the sharp business panics that occurred in 1834 and 1837.
sentences.cn: 杰克逊的做法加速了1834年和1837年发生的经济恐慌.

sentences.en: The clouds precipitate / are precipitatedas snow in winter.
The killings in Vilnius have precipitated the worst crisis yet.
sentences.cn: 维尔纽斯的杀戮事件快速引发了迄今为止最严重的危机。

sentences.en: The king was too precipitate in declaring war.
sentences.cn: 国王在宣战一事上过于轻率.

sentences.en: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.cn: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.en: This precipitate dissolves in an excess of aqueous ammonia.
sentences.cn: 这个沉淀能溶解在过量的氨水中.

words.tran_cn: 勇往直前的；急促的；突如其来的
起沉淀作用的；急落的；猛冲的
[化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
[化学] 沉淀剂，[矿业] 沉淀器；催促的人
突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
[化学]沉淀；猛地落下；冷凝成为雨或雪等
[化学]使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入

trans.tran_cn: 仓促行进的，匆促的，轻率的，鲁莽的，草率的；仓促的冲动行事的，突然发生的，猛地落下的
trans.tran_en: happening or done too quickly, and not thought about carefully
a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

trans.tran_cn: 使突然发生； 猛然抛下； 使沉淀
trans.tran_en: to separate a solid substance from a liquid by chemical action, or to be separated in this way

trans.tran_cn: [气象]凝结，[化]沉淀，倒落，一头栽下
下掷，由高处抛下，使提前或突然发生，加速（坏事的发生），[气象] 使凝结而下降，冷凝成为雨或雪等，[化]使沉淀
